gurmukhi: qyrI swm qkweI; dyvI durg swh ]4]
translation: “O goddess Durga, I have come under Thy refuge.”4.
Listening to these words (of Indra), Durga laughed heartily.
She sent for that lion, who was she devourer of demons.

gurmukhi: icMqw krhu n kweI; dyvW nUM AwiKAw ]
translation: She said to gods, “Do not worry mother any more.”

gurmukhi: roh hoeI mhw mweI; rwkis mwrxy ]5]
transliteration: Roh Hooo Mahaa Maaoo Rakas(i) Maarane||5||
translation: For killing the demons, the great mother exhibited great fury.5.

gurmukhi: rwkis Awey rohly; Kyq iBVn ky cwie ]
transliteration: Rakas(i) Aae Rohale Khet Bhidan Ke Chaae||
translation: The infuriated demons came with the desire of fighting in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: lskn qygW brCIAW; sUrju ndir n pwie ]6]
transliteration: Lashkan Tegadn Barchhodhaan Sooraj(u) Nadir(i0 Na Paae||6||
translation: The swords and daggers glisten with such brilliance that the sun cannot be seen.6.

gurmukhi: duhW kMDwrW muih juVy; Fol sMK ngwry b`jy ]
transliteration: Duhaan Kandhaaraa Muh(i0 Jude Dhol Sankh Nagdare Bajje||
translation: Both the armies faced each other and the drums, conches and trumpets sounded.

gurmukhi: rwkis Awey rohly; qrvwrI bKqr s`jy ]
transliteration: Raakas(i) Aae Rohale Tarvaroo Bakhtar Sajje||
translation: The demons came in great rage, decorated with swords and armour.

gurmukhi: ju`ty sauhy ju`D nUM; iek jwq n jwxn B`jy ]
transliteration: Joutte Sauhe Juddh Noon Ik Jaat Na Jaanan Bhajje||
translation: The warriors were facing the war-front and none of them knows to retrace his steps.
The brave fighters were roaring in the battlefield.7.
